abstract: Lt Col Daniel Gade, professor of public policy at West Point, has begun campaign arguing that Veterans Affairs Dept should move away from paying disability to veterans and instead create incentives for them to work or create businesses; Gade, veteran who lost a leg in combat, says disability checks can keep veterans locked in idleness and diminish their sense of self worth.
lead_paragraph: Lt. Col. Daniel Gade is traveling the country to urge a shift toward work incentives for disabled veterans, but some find his message misguided.

byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

snippet: Lt. Col. Daniel Gade is traveling the country to urge a shift toward work incentives for disabled veterans, but some find his message misguided.

keywords.value: Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Iraq Veteran, Now a West Point Professor, Seeks to Rein In Disability Pay
headline.print_headline: Veteran’s Campaign Would Rein In Disability Pay
